metadata.title: Two Cathedrals
metadata.time_reference: During the President's campaign and after the loss of a close advisor

releases.details: The West Wing: The Complete Second Season

notes: This episode heavily features flashbacks, highlighting the character's memories with Mrs. Landingham.
The episode is known for its powerful closing monologue by President Bartlet.

in_universe_mythology: The significance of the National Cathedral as a place of mourning and remembrance.
real_world_cultural_references: Refers to the real-life events involving the MS (Multiple Sclerosis) scandal.

continuity_notes: The events in this episode tie back to President Bartlet's previous decisions regarding his health and campaign.

plot.plot_summary: In this emotional season finale, President Bartlet struggles with the loss of his trusted secretary, Mrs. Landingham, and confronts his past choices, all while preparing for a press conference that will determine the future of his presidency and campaign.
